summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the receipt and delivery of financial records from USAA bank related to Ghislaine Maxwell. It confirms that records from a subpoena were received and a copy was delivered to the SDNY (Southern District of New York).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the subpoena for banking records from USAA, referenced in the email chain regarding the preparation and delivery of those records to the SDNY.

events.title: USAA records request notification
events.description: ClaimFox notifies the U.S. Attorney's Office that the request for banking records for Ghislaine Maxwell from USAA has been received and is being prepared.

events.title: Delivery of Maxwell's financial records to SDNY
events.description: Email correspondence confirms that financial records from USAA related to Ghislaine Maxwell have been received and a copy was dropped off to the Southern District of New York (SDNY).

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively subpoenaing Ghislaine Maxwell's banking records from USAA as part of a criminal investigation in late 2019/early 2020.
A service called ClaimFox was used to manage the request for financial records from USAA, with a specific invoice and claim number referenced.
The records were successfully obtained and delivered to the Southern District of New York prosecutors by January 6, 2020.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the prosecution team regarding the receipt and tracking of these investigative materials.
The document is part of the evidence file (EFTA00084207) related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
